ygData.subject: Sneak/song?
ygData.msgSnippet: Has anyone else noticed that you can now sneak while playing selo s?   You actually go a little slower, but I wonder if this actually works (ie. fast
ygData.messageBody:
Has anyone else noticed that you can now sneak while playing selo's? You
actually go a little slower, but I wonder if this actually works (ie. fast
sneaking). But then again I never could quite get the hang of sneak... All
the mobs seem to want to hang out with their backs to walls...

Oh yeah, and you can hide while playing songs as well.

Olgwinn Pendragun
Bard of the 49th Song (oops, there still isn't a 49th song)
E'ci




> Date: Tue, 21 Nov 2000 13:27:25 -0000
> From: "Piemur Draggonsinger Wood Elf Bard of the 32nd Song"
><etop03@...>
>Subject: Patch Message
>
>Patch process complete.
>**********************************************************************
>********
>
>November 21st, 3:00am
>------------------------------
>
>*Patch Day*
>
>Today's patch addresses a few problems noted by customers since last
>week's big patch. The following changes were made:
>
>- Fixed some problems with sound volume being set above the maximum
>or below the minimum.
>- Fixed a problem that caused sound volume to be reset regardless of
>the slider setting upon zoning or entering game.
>- Fixed a bug that would cause some sounds to be unduly amplified
>whenever the volume slider was moved.
>- Fixed a bug causing pink fringes to show on whiskers in association
>with mipmapping.
>- Fixed a bug with /usercolor causing settings to be saved in the
>wrong slot.
>- Fixed weapon scaling problems with off-hand weapons and those
>carried by dwarves.
>- Fixed a bug that caused the client to display an amount of
>experience in slight disagreement with the server.
>- Fixed the Paladin Epic Quest reward, which was procing a spell that
>would do around one million points of damage if left to its
>own devices.
>- Fixed a faction problem that made some quests designed to be doable
>by anyone, regardless of race or class, undoable.
>
>In other news, the Tarew/Povar split server, Xev, will be up
>following the patch today. Xev is named for Xev Bristlebane, the god
>of fortune. We would have named the new server under its full name
>if not for an attempt to avoid confusion between the existing
>"Bristlebane" server (named for Fizzlethorpe Bristlebane) and Xev.
>
>- The EverQuest Team
>
>
>Just hope they didn't mess with invis song and sneak/hide breakage.
>If anyone gets on(I didn't), let us know anything you discover.
>
>Piemur Draggonsinger
